byline.contributor: Lilia Blaise and Benoît Morenne contributed reporting.

abstract: Report by French newspaper Le Canard Enchaine about exorbitant fees paid to Pres Francois Hollande's personal hairdresser since his election in 2012 further deepens his unpopularity; Hollande already is unpopular as he has failed to deliver on his promise to lower youth unemployment, and has been forced to agree to primary to settle on presidential candidate in 2017.

headline.print_headline: Haircuts for a President, and Maybe the Taxpayers
headline.main: A Haircut for French Taxpayers? Hollande’s $10,000-a-Month Stylist Is Revealed

snippet: Revelations that President François Hollande’s hairdresser is paid about as much as a government minister have caused a stir in France....
lead_paragraph: Revelations that President François Hollande’s hairdresser is paid about as much as a government minister have caused a stir in France.
